intro: Calylophus berlandieri subsp. pinifolius, commonly known as the Mexican false heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and needle-like, resembling those of coniferous trees. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or wooded areas.
